thread.title: Krauthammer On The Looming Gorsuch Vote: Clint Eastwood Said It Best …
thread.title_full: Krauthammer On The Looming Gorsuch Vote: Clint Eastwood Said It Best …

author: Jack Davis
title: Krauthammer On The Looming Gorsuch Vote: Clint Eastwood Said It Best …
text:
Dems Planning To Filibuster Gorsuch Nomination May Want To Heed Obama’s Advice 
Krauthammer said that although Schumer might win the battle to deny Gorsuch 60 votes, he could still lose the war. 
“If Schumer wants to trigger the nuclear option, I would quote Clint Eastwood with those immortal words: ‘Make My Day,’ because it would be a disaster for the Democrats,” Krauthammer said on Fox News Channel. 
If the bar is lowered to 51 votes, Trump will not need to be the least restrained when picking his next court nominee, Krauthammer said. At least three current justices are nearing the age when justices often retire. Advertisement - story continues below 
If another vacancy emerges and Trump does not need any Democratic support, his nominee will “not be from central casting,” Krauthammer said, and likely be more to the political right than Gorsuch. 
“It’s going to be a much harder-edged conservative,” he said. “And it will be easy as hell for the Republicans to get him through, or her through, requiring only 51 (votes).” 
Republicans have been split on the use of the nuclear option, with most hewing the line of Sen. John Cornyn , R-Texas. 
“I hope it doesn’t come to that, but if the Democrats force our hand, then we’ll be prepared to do what we need to do to confirm the judge,” Cornyn said. Advertisement - story continues below
